conclusion: Analyzing the cyclic process shown in the figure.
The P-V diagram shows a cyclic process A→B→C→D→A with vertical axis as Pressure in units of 10⁵ Pa and horizontal axis as Volume in units of L.
State A: P = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 3 L, T = 27°C = 300 K.
State B: P = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 4 L.
State C: P = 0.75×10⁵ Pa, V = 4 L.
State D: P = 0.75×10⁵ Pa, V = 3 L.
The work done by the gas is given by: W = ∫P·dV.
For the path C→D, it is a constant pressure process (isobaric) at P = 0.75×10⁵ Pa.
Volume changes from V = 4 L to V = 3 L (volume decreases).
For a constant pressure process, the work formula simplifies to: W = P·(Vfinal - Vinitial).
The negative sign indicates that work is done ON the gas (not BY the gas) during the compression from C to D.
To find the work done BY the gas (externally), we take the negative: Work done externally by the gas = -(-75 J) = 75 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state C to state D is -75 J.
